verb.description: Experience a seemingly real perception of something not actually present, typically as a result of a mental disorder or of taking drugs.
examples: people sense themselves going mad and hallucinate about spiders

origin: Mid 17th century (in the sense be deceived, have illusions): from Latin hallucinat- gone astray in thought, from the verb hallucinari, from Greek alussein be uneasy or distraught.
